intro: Pittosporum ioides, commonly known as the silver pittosporum, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its evergreen foliage, which features a silvery-gray underside and dark green upper surface. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal. Pittosporum ioides is also valued for its ability to tolerate coastal conditions and its use in landscaping.
